definition.name: securid-domain
definition.description: The SecurID Realm that this driver will be performing administration in.

definition.name: command-client-username
definition.description: The username that the driver will use to connect to the API connector. (Usually CmdClient_XXXXXXXX)

definition.name: command-client-password
definition.description: The password that the driver will use to connect to the API connector.

definition.name: command-client-naming-factory
definition.description: The JNDI Naming Factory Class for the driver to use to connect to the API connector.

definition.name: command-client-provider-url
definition.description: The URL for the command client endpoint that the driver should connect to. Multiple endpoints may be listed as a comma-separated list.

definition.name: pub-heartbeat-interval
definition.description: Configures the driver shim to send a periodic status message on the publisher channel when there has been no publisher traffic for the given number of seconds.

definition.display-name: Subscriber channel retry interval in seconds
definition.name: dirxml.engine.retry-interval
definition.description: The subscriber channel retry interval controls how frequently the DirXML Engine will retry the processing of a cached transaction after the application shim's Subscriber object returns a retry status.

definition.display-name: Qualified form for DN-syntax attribute values
definition.name: dirxml.engine.qualified-dn-values
definition.description: The qualified form for DN-syntax attribute values controls whether values for DN-syntax attribute values are presented in unqualified slash form or qualified slash form. A "true" setting means the values are presented in qualified form.

definition.name: dirxml.engine.qualified-rename-values
definition.description: The qualified form for rename events controls whether the new-name portion of rename events coming from the Identity Vault are presented to the Subscriber channel with type qualifier(s) (e.g. CN=). A "true" setting means the names are presented in qualified form.

definition.display-name: Maximum eDirectory replication wait time in seconds
definition.name: dirxml.engine.max-replication-wait
definition.description: The maximum eDirectory replication wait time controls the maximum time that the DirXML Engine will wait for a particular change to replicate between the local replica and a remote replica. This only affects operations where the DirXML Engine is required to contact a remote eDirectory server in the same tree to perform an operation and may need to wait until some change has replicated to or from the remote server before the operation can be completed (e.g. object moves when the DirXML server does not hold the master replica of the moved object ;file system rights operations for Users created from a template.)

definition.display-name: Use non-compliant backwards-compatible mode for XSLT
definition.name: dirxml.engine.xslt-bc-mode
definition.description:
This control sets the XSLT processor used by the DirXML Engine to a backwards-compatible mode. The backwards-compatible mode causes the XSLT processor to use one or more behaviors that are not XPath 1.0 and/or XSLT 1.0 standards-compliant. This is done in the interest of backwards-compatiblity with existing DirXML stylesheets that depend on the non-standard behavior(s).
In particular:
The behavior of the XPath "!=" operator when one operand is a node-set and the other operand is other than a node-set is incorrect in DirXML releases up to and including DirXML 2.0 (Novell Identity Manager 2.0). This behavior has been corrected; however, the corrected behavior is disabled by default through this control in favor of backwards-compatibility with existing DirXML stylesheets.

definition.display-name: Maximum application objects to migrate at once
definition.name: dirxml.engine.max-migrate-app-count
definition.description:
This control is used to limit the number of application objects that the DirXML Engine will request from an application during a single query that is performed as part of a "migrate objects from application" operation.
If "java.lang.OutOfMemoryError" errors are encountered during a migrate from application operation then this number should be set lower than the default.
Note that this control does not limit the number of application objects that can be migrated; it merely limits the "batch size".

definition.display-name: Set creatorsName on objects created in Identity Vault
definition.name: dirxml.engine.set-creators-name
definition.description:
This control is used by the DirXML Engine to determine if the creatorsName attribute should be set to the DN of this driver on all objects created in the Identity Vault by this driver.
Setting the creatorsName attribute allows for easily identifying objects created by this driver, but also carries a performance penalty. If not set, the creatorsName attribute will default to the DN of the NCP Server object that is hosting the driver.

definition.name: dirxml.engine.use-pending-association
definition.description:
This control determines whether the DirXML Engine will write a pending association on an object during subscriber channel processing.
Writing a pending association confers little or no benefit but does incur a performance penalty. Nevertheless, the option exists to turn it on for backward compatibility.

definition.name: dirxml.engine.use-password-event-values
definition.description:
This control determines the source of the value reported for the nspmDistributionPassword attribute for subscriber channel add and modify events.
Setting the control to false means that the current value of nspmDistributionPassword is obtained and reported as the value of the attribute event. This means that only the current password value is available. This is the default behavior.
Setting the control to true means that the value recorded with the eDirectory event will be decrypted and reported as the value of the attribute event. This means that both the old password value (if it exists) and the replacement password value at the time of the event are available. This is useful for synchronizing passwords to certain applications that require the old password to enable setting a new password.

definition.name: dirxml.engine.pwd-sync-status
definition.description:
This control determines whether the DirXML Engine will report the status of subscriber channel password change events.
Reporting the status of subscriber channel password change events allows applications such as the Identity Manager User Application to monitor the synchronization progress of a password change that should be synchronized to the connected application.

definition.display-name: Combine values from template object with those from add operation
definition.name: dirxml.engine.combine-template-values
definition.description: This control determines how the DirXML Engine will use values from a template object when the template is used to create objects in the Identity Vault. Setting the control to true causes multi-valued attribute values from the template to be used in addition to those values for the same attribute that are specified in the add operation. Setting the control to false causes the value(s) from the template to be ignored if there are values for the same attribute specified in the add operation.

definition.display-name: Allow event loopback from publisher to subscriber channel
definition.name: dirxml.engine.allow-event-loopback
definition.description: This control determines whether the DirXML Engine will allow an event to loopback from the publisher channel of a driver to the subscriber channel of the same driver. Setting the control to false means that the loopback of the event from the publisher to the subscriber channel will not be allowed. Setting the control to true means that events would flow from the publisher channel to the subscriber channel of the same driver.

definition.display-name: Revert to calculated membership value behavior
definition.name: dirxml.engine.use-calculated-values
definition.description:
Prior to Identity Manager 3.6 the DirXML Engine retrieved "calculated" values for the attributes "Member" and "Group Membership". The Engine now retrieves static values. This behavior is more generally useful and makes synchronizing Nested Groups possible. Setting this control to true reverts to the pre-3.6 behavior.
It is possible even with the post-3.6 default behavior to read the calculated values for "Member" and "Group Membership" by using the special attribute names "[pseudo].Member" and "[pseudo].Group Membership".

definition.display-name: Maximum time to wait for driver shutdown in seconds
definition.name: dirxml.engine.max-driver-shutdown-timeout
definition.description: This control determines the maximum time in seconds for which the DirXML Engine will wait for the drivers publisher channel to shutdown. If the driver does not shutdown within the provided time value, then the driver will be terminated by the DirXML Engine.

definition.name: dirxml.engine.reg-ex-escape-chars
definition.description:
This control determines the meta-characters that will be escaped while evaluating regular expressions. If a meta-char is not present in control value then it will not be escaped during local variable expansion containing a regular expression.
To escape all the regular expression meta-characters, "\,$,^,.,?,*,+,[,],(,),|" should be added as the value.
If a meta-character need not be escaped, then remove it from the control value.
The control value should be a valid comma(,) separated list, else errors may be encountered during policy evaluation.

definition.name: gcvDriverRealm
definition.description: The name of the realm on the SecurID server that we will be working with.

definition.display-name: Default High Level container for External Users

definition.description: External Users container (to be used for User scope filtering and matching)

definition.name: gcvDefaultCompanyContainer
definition.description: Container to be used for Company scope filtering

definition.description: Internal Users container (to be used for User scope filtering and matching)

definition.name: gcvInternalServiceAccountContainer
definition.description: Internal Service Account Container (to be used for User scope filtering and matching)

definition.description: The Human Resources System contains this textual description to identify Terminated Objects.

definition.name: gcvPrehireText
gcvActivatedText
definition.description: The Human Resources System contains this textual description to identify Active Objects.

definition.name: gcvUserIDAttribute
definition.description: The eDirectory attribute which contains the unique User identifier.

definition.display-name: Attribute to use for Unique Company Identifier
definition.name: gcvCompanyIDAttribute
definition.description: The eDirectory attribute which contains the unique Company identifier

definition.name: gcvUserTypeTextEmployee

definition.name: gcvUserTypeTextVendor

definition.name: gcvUMBGUIDLength
definition.description: Used to check if the length of umbGUID originating in Online Banking is too long

definition.display-name: umbAccess Flag for Auto internet Access
definition.name: gcvUMBInternetUserAuto

definition.display-name: umbAccess Flag for Manual internet Access

definition.display-name: umbAccess Flag for Auto RACF Entitlement

definition.description: The Text to be placed in umbAccess when an automatic entitlement has been granted through Role Based Entitlement

definition.display-name: umbAccess Flag for Manual RACF Entitlement

definition.name: gcvUMBRACFUserDisable
definition.description: The text that is displayed in the umbAccess Attribute for the RACF entitlement revoked through MPT.

definition.name: GCV_RandomPasswordSettings
definition.description: These Settings determine how the password will be generated. The first number represents the Password Length (not including the "#" sign appended to the end of all passwords. The second Digit refers to how many letters. And the third and final number refers to the number of numeric characters to use. Please Note that the second and third number need to equal the first number or an error will occur during password creation.

definition.name: gcvMPTTriggerDateFormat
definition.description: This is used when converting a date format like 01-JAN-06 from the EVENTLOG into an eDirectory Date format.

definition.name: gcvDefaultRetailUserContainer
definition.description: Default Container for Retail Users

text-var.description: When importing a configuration containing a policy library that was outside the context of what was exported, you must specify the container in which you want the imported policy library created. All references to policies within this policy library will be adjusted to correspond to its new location.
text-var.prompt: Select the container where you want to create the policy library named 'UMB Driver Library'.
